description: Square array a(n,k) read by antidiagonals: a(n,1)=n, a(1,k)=k, a(n,k)=a(n-1,k-1)+a(n-1,k)+a(n,k-1)+1.
references: M. L. Fredman, The complexity of maintaining an array and its partial sums, J. Assoc. Comp. Machin., 29 (1982), 250-260.
links: D. E. Knuth and N. J. A. Sloane, Correspondence, December 1999
formula: a(n, k) =(A008288(n, k)-1)/2. Sum of antidiagonals is A048776.
maple: A047662 := proc(n,k) option remember; if n = 1 then k; elif k = 1 then n; else A047662(n-1,k-1)+A047662(n,k-1)+A047662(n-1,k)+1; fi; end;
mathematica: a[n_, 1] := n; a[1, k_] := k; a[n_, k_] := a[n, k] = a[n-1, k-1] + a[n-1, k] + a[n, k-1] + 1; Table[ a[n-k+1, k], {n, 1, 11}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Aug 13 2013 *)
crossrefs: Rows give A037237, 4*A006007, A047661, A047663, A047664, main diagonal is A047665 (see also A001850).
author: _Don Knuth_, _N. J. A. Sloane_
